trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement Troubleshooting Guide - Analytics
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement Troubleshooting Guide - Analytics

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting Analytics, Monitoring, Segmentation, and Dashboard issues in Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting Analytics, Monitoring, Segmentation, and Dashboard issues in Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting guide for Analytics, Monitoring, Segmentation, and Dashboard issues
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting guide for Analytics, Monitoring, Segmentation, and Dashboard issues

trans-unit.source: The following are possible issues you may encounter with how Azure Mobile Engagement gathers information about your applications, devices, and users.
trans-unit.target: The following are possible issues you may encounter with how Azure Mobile Engagement gathers information about your applications, devices, and users.

trans-unit.source: Missing/Delayed information
trans-unit.target: Missing/Delayed information

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Information is delayed in appearing in Analytics, Segmentation, or Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Information is delayed in appearing in Analytics, Segmentation, or Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Information is missing from Monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Information is missing from Monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Information is missing from Analytics, Segmentation, or Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Information is missing from Analytics, Segmentation, or Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Hitting segmentation limits.
trans-unit.target: Hitting segmentation limits.

trans-unit.source: Causes
trans-unit.target: Causes

trans-unit.source: You can use the Analytics API, Monitor API, and Segments API to see if any data you are missing from the UI is visible through the APIs.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Analytics API, Monitor API, and Segments API to see if any data you are missing from the UI is visible through the APIs.

trans-unit.source: If the Azure Mobile Engagement SDK is not correctly integrated into your app then you won't be able to see information in the Analytics, Segmentation, Monitoring, or Dashboards.
trans-unit.target: If the Azure Mobile Engagement SDK is not correctly integrated into your app then you won't be able to see information in the Analytics, Segmentation, Monitoring, or Dashboards.

trans-unit.source: Segments can't be changed once they are created, segments can only be "cloned" (copied) or "destroyed" (deleted).
trans-unit.target: Segments can't be changed once they are created, segments can only be "cloned" (copied) or "destroyed" (deleted).

trans-unit.source: Segments can only contain 10 criteria.
trans-unit.target: Segments can only contain 10 criteria.

trans-unit.source: The best way to test missing information from monitoring is to setup a test device, uninstall and/or reinstall the app on the test device.
trans-unit.target: The best way to test missing information from monitoring is to setup a test device, uninstall and/or reinstall the app on the test device.

trans-unit.source: Information is refreshed every 24 hours for Analytics, Segmentation, or Dashboards.
trans-unit.target: Information is refreshed every 24 hours for Analytics, Segmentation, or Dashboards.

trans-unit.source: Information in new segments may not be displayed until 24 hours after they are created even if the segment is based on previous information.
trans-unit.target: Information in new segments may not be displayed until 24 hours after they are created even if the segment is based on previous information.

trans-unit.source: Filtering your analytics data in the UI will show all examples of this type regardless of the version of your app (e.g. "Crashes" filtered by name will show from version 1 and version 2 of your app).
trans-unit.target: Filtering your analytics data in the UI will show all examples of this type regardless of the version of your app (e.g. "Crashes" filtered by name will show from version 1 and version 2 of your app).

trans-unit.source: The time period for Analytics is based on the date from the users' device settings, so a user whose phone has the date incorrectly set could show up in the wrong time period.
trans-unit.target: The time period for Analytics is based on the date from the users' device settings, so a user whose phone has the date incorrectly set could show up in the wrong time period.

trans-unit.source: No server side data is logged when you use the button to "test" pushes, data is only logged for real push campaigns.
trans-unit.target: No server side data is logged when you use the button to "test" pushes, data is only logged for real push campaigns.

trans-unit.source: Can't locate items in UI
trans-unit.target: Can't locate items in UI

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Can't create segments based on certain built in or custom app info tag criteria.
trans-unit.target: Can't create segments based on certain built in or custom app info tag criteria.

trans-unit.source: Can't find certain built in or custom app info tag criteria in Analytics, Monitoring, or Dashboards.
trans-unit.target: Can't find certain built in or custom app info tag criteria in Analytics, Monitoring, or Dashboards.

trans-unit.source: Can't interpret the data in Analytics, Monitoring, Segmentation, or Dashboards.
trans-unit.target: Can't interpret the data in Analytics, Monitoring, Segmentation, or Dashboards.

trans-unit.source: Causes
trans-unit.target: Causes

trans-unit.source: Some built in items and app info tags are only available as push criteria but may not be added to a segment or visible from Analytics, Monitoring, or Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Some built in items and app info tags are only available as push criteria but may not be added to a segment or visible from Analytics, Monitoring, or Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: For built in items and app info tags that can't be added to a segment, you will need to setup list of targeting criteria in each campaign to perform the same function as targeting based on a segment.
trans-unit.target: For built in items and app info tags that can't be added to a segment, you will need to setup list of targeting criteria in each campaign to perform the same function as targeting based on a segment.

trans-unit.source: See the context menus in the Analytics, Monitoring, Segmentation, and Dashboards sections of the Azure Mobile Engagement UI for more help and how to information.
trans-unit.target: See the context menus in the Analytics, Monitoring, Segmentation, and Dashboards sections of the Azure Mobile Engagement UI for more help and how to information.

trans-unit.source: Crash troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Crash troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Application Crashes appearing in Analytics, Monitoring, or Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Application Crashes appearing in Analytics, Monitoring, or Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Causes
trans-unit.target: Causes

trans-unit.source: To troubleshoot Application Crashes seen in Analytics, Monitoring, or Dashboard make sure to check the release notes for known issues with previous versions of the SDK.
trans-unit.target: To troubleshoot Application Crashes seen in Analytics, Monitoring, or Dashboard make sure to check the release notes for known issues with previous versions of the SDK.

trans-unit.source: To further troubleshoot application crashes perform an event from a test device with your application installed and look up your device ID in the “Monitor – Events” section of the Azure Mobile Engagement UI.
trans-unit.target: To further troubleshoot application crashes perform an event from a test device with your application installed and look up your device ID in the “Monitor – Events” section of the Azure Mobile Engagement UI.

trans-unit.source: Then perform the event that is causing your application to crash and look up additional information in the “Monitor – Crash” section of the Azure Mobile Engagement UI.
trans-unit.target: Then perform the event that is causing your application to crash and look up additional information in the “Monitor – Crash” section of the Azure Mobile Engagement UI.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
